name: 100-man no Inochi no Ue ni Ore wa Tatteiru

genre.name: Action
genre.descripcion: The action genre in anime represents extremely high levels of intense action. Often, you will witness thrilling battles and action-packed fight scenes in shows of this genre. These series will either make you jump out of your seat or knock your socks off. In general, the action genre usually has a lot of battle scenes, smooth animation and very engaging elements that will get your adrenaline pumping.

genre.name: Drama
genre.descripcion: Bringing us tears and a wave of emotions is basically what the drama genre does best! Dramatic anime tends to connect viewers to the experiences of the characters. This results in viewers feeling what the characters are going through. Whether it's a tingle of emotion or a flood of feelings, the goal of these series is to touch our hearts. In anime, one of the biggest signs that the drama worked effectively is if it was able to make you cry.

genre.name: Fantasy
genre.descripcion: The fantasy genre in anime deals mainly with fantasy worlds and surreal events and locations. Most of the time, the setting is a magical world where the characters begin an adventure. Sometimes they are sent there from the real world. Magic is often a component of this genre, and various mystical elements serve as building blocks of the story. You'll often know it's a fantasy anime if the setting and atmosphere seem so dazzling and dreamlike that it will make you feel captivated and seduced.

genre.name: Game
genre.descripcion: The gaming category encompasses shows that revolve around the idea of play and fun. Anime can include a card game, a board game, a puzzle game, or even a virtual online game. As long as it is any playable game of any kind, it belongs to this category. Sometimes even video game-based programs can count in this selection.

genre.name: Shounen
genre.descripcion: Shounen refers to the target demographic for this type of anime, which is male viewers around 10 to 18 years of age. These shows are usually a combination of action and adventure and are typically adapted from manga series. As such, these anime tend to have long runs.

description: Yusuke Yotsuya is transported to an alternative game-like world. He becomes a third player and sets out on a dangerous quest with his classmates Iu Shindo and Kusue Hakozaki, who were transported there before.

name: 11 Eyes

genre.name: Action
genre.descripcion: The action genre in anime represents extremely high levels of intense action. Often, you will witness thrilling battles and action-packed fight scenes in shows of this genre. These series will either make you jump out of your seat or knock your socks off. In general, the action genre usually has a lot of battle scenes, smooth animation and very engaging elements that will get your adrenaline pumping.

genre.name: Ecchi
genre.descripcion: The word ecchi comes from the H sound in the word hentai, which in turn means perverted in Japanese. This subgenre is generally accepted for being full of sexually provocative scenes (mild enough to be seen by the general public) and scenarios derived from innuendo and humorous situations.

genre.name: Super powers
genre.descripcion: You know you're watching a superpower anime if you see a series of explosive superpowers fighting on screen. If you see energy ball explosions, death-defying attacks, and opposing forces fighting throughout the story, it means you're probably witnessing a show in this subgenre.

genre.name: Supernatural
genre.descripcion: When one says supernatural, it refers to things or events that are strange and out of the ordinary. For this category, supernatural could refer to something mythical, mystical, strange or something outside the bounds of accepted reality. There is a shadow of mystery often found in shows related to this genre.

description: 11 eyes follows the childhood friendship of Satsuki Kakeru and Minase Yuka, who grew up together living ordinary lives - until one unexpected day where they are both transported to a different world.

name: 7 Seeds

genre.name: Action
genre.descripcion: The action genre in anime represents extremely high levels of intense action. Often, you will witness thrilling battles and action-packed fight scenes in shows of this genre. These series will either make you jump out of your seat or knock your socks off. In general, the action genre usually has a lot of battle scenes, smooth animation and very engaging elements that will get your adrenaline pumping.

genre.name: Adventure
genre.descripcion: The adventure genre consists of traveling and undertaking an adventure in a certain place or around the world (which can sometimes escalate to the whole universe or even to other dimensions). In this genre, the protagonists do not usually stay in one place. They venture to several different locations, usually with a goal in mind (e.g., to find treasure, explore some new place, defeat a heinous villain, or save the world). Adventure anime is so broad and flexible that these shows can run to a large number of episodes, as well as overlap multiple genres, usually action.

genre.name: Drama
genre.descripcion: Bringing us tears and a wave of emotions is basically what the drama genre does best! Dramatic anime tends to connect viewers to the experiences of the characters. This results in viewers feeling what the characters are going through. Whether it's a tingle of emotion or a flood of feelings, the goal of these series is to touch our hearts. In anime, one of the biggest signs that the drama worked effectively is if it was able to make you cry.

genre.name: Mystery
genre.descripcion: If there is one thing that is similar in all mystery anime shows, it is the existence of a central enigma. Whether it's an event, a place, or an object, there is some sort of mystery surrounding the narrative. In the history of anime, the most popular shows in the genre have featured detectives.

genre.name: Science Fiction
genre.descripcion: Science fiction is a genre that shows scientific and technological elements in its story. Machines and various types of technologies are basic elements of this genre. Most of the time, it focuses on the advancement and development of science and technology. That is why you often find science fiction combined with subgenres such as mechanics and space.

genre.name: Shoujo
genre.descripcion: Shoujo refers to the demographic of young girls. This subgenre specifically targets female viewers between the ages of 10 and 18. Most of the time, shoujo anime works hand in hand with the romance and comedy genre, particularly the former. The protagonist is traditionally female and the narrative focuses on romance as well as personal growth. The world in these shows is often highly idealized.

genre.name: Terror
genre.descripcion: It's not hard to spot the horror genre in anime. Generally, if there are ghosts, monsters, gore, and creeps, then you're probably watching a horror series. Heavy gore and bloody violence is a common trait. The most important factor for a show to be considered horror is its ability to scare and frighten people.

description: In the immediate future, a giant meteorite has collided with earth. All living organisms, including mankind, have been wiped off the face of the planet.

name: AI no Idenshi

genre.name: Psychologic
genre.descripcion: Psychological anime are shows that delve into the workings of the mind and psyche. This genre tackles everything on a psychological (sometimes even philosophical) level. You'll often find mind games here, as well as battles where the use of wits is the main focus. Series of this genre will play with your mind and make you think a lot.

Most of the time, it focuses on the advancement and development of science and technology. That is why you often find science fiction combined with subgenres such as mechanics and space.

genre.name: Suspense
genre.descripcion: Also known as intrigue, these films develop quickly, and all their elements revolve around the same intriguing element.

description: A doctor who treats robot and humanoid problems takes place in the near future when humanoids with AI account for 10% of the population. Hikaru Sudô, also known as Moggadeet, secretly takes on illegal medical procedures.

name: Aa! Megami-sama

genre.name: Comedy
genre.descripcion: The main purpose of the comedy genre is...you got it...to make you laugh! If it doesn't make you laugh or at least make you smile, then it's a failure. But then again, humor can depend on your personal sense of humor. The animation may not be as impressive as TV shows in the action and drama category, but that can be forgiven for the laughs. Funny moments, hilarious scenes, wacky dialogue, comical happenings... it's all covered by the comedy genre in anime!

genre.name: Magic
genre.descripcion: Magic, in all its essence, is about magical things like spells and incantations. It can also include magic fountains, wish-granting beings, and good sleight-of-hand tricks. One of the most famous themes in the magic genre is magical girls. It is so popular that it could become a whole new genre on its own in the future.

genre.name: Romance
genre.descripcion: Romance is all about love and sweet moments. Shows of this genre often have the ability to strike a chord with everyone with their romantic scenes and tender moments. The focus of these shows are the romantic relationships between the characters as well as their blossoming love for each other. You will often find romantic anime closely tied to the shoujo subgenre, but it also works quite well with comedy, harem and drama.

genre.name: Seinen
genre.descripcion: Seinen is actually a demographic, but it is also considered a category in anime. It is a subgenre that specifically targets male viewers between the ages of 18 and 40. Shows here are portrayed in a more mature light and often include more explicit content such as gore, sex and violence. There are also more cerebral narratives.

genre.descripcion: The main purpose of the comedy genre is...you got it...to make you laugh! If it doesn't make you laugh or at least make you smile, then it's a failure. But then again, humor can depend on your personal sense of humor. The animation may not be as impressive as TV shows in the action and drama category, but that can be forgiven for the laughs. Funny moments, hilarious scenes, wacky dialogue, comical happenings... it's all covered by the comedy genre in anime!

genre.name: Harem
genre.descripcion: If you see a reluctant male character surrounded by multiple adoring female characters, then you're probably watching an anime of the harem subgenre. This type of show usually features more than two female characters being turned upside down by a single male character. Anime in this category is typically within the comedy and romance genre.

genre.name: Romance
genre.descripcion: Romance is all about love and sweet moments. Shows of this genre often have the ability to strike a chord with everyone with their romantic scenes and tender moments. The focus of these shows are the romantic relationships between the characters as well as their blossoming love for each other. You will often find romantic anime closely tied to the shoujo subgenre, but it also works quite well with comedy, harem and drama.

genre.name: School
genre.descripcion: There are countless anime that use school as a setting. An anime can be considered part of the school subgenre if the school is the main setting and the anime is primarily about school and student life.

description: Juni'ichi Nagase is a high school sophomore who saves new student Yuuhi from harassment, only to find out that she is to be his future wife!

name: Akatsuki no Yona

genre.name: Action
genre.descripcion: The action genre in anime represents extremely high levels of intense action. Often, you will witness thrilling battles and action-packed fight scenes in shows of this genre. These series will either make you jump out of your seat or knock your socks off. In general, the action genre usually has a lot of battle scenes, smooth animation and very engaging elements that will get your adrenaline pumping.

genre.name: Adventure
genre.descripcion: The adventure genre consists of traveling and undertaking an adventure in a certain place or around the world (which can sometimes escalate to the whole universe or even to other dimensions). In this genre, the protagonists do not usually stay in one place. They venture to several different locations, usually with a goal in mind (e.g., to find treasure, explore some new place, defeat a heinous villain, or save the world). Adventure anime is so broad and flexible that these shows can run to a large number of episodes, as well as overlap multiple genres, usually action.

genre.name: Comedy
genre.descripcion: The main purpose of the comedy genre is...you got it...to make you laugh! If it doesn't make you laugh or at least make you smile, then it's a failure. But then again, humor can depend on your personal sense of humor. The animation may not be as impressive as TV shows in the action and drama category, but that can be forgiven for the laughs. Funny moments, hilarious scenes, wacky dialogue, comical happenings... it's all covered by the comedy genre in anime!

genre.name: Fantasy
genre.descripcion: The fantasy genre in anime deals mainly with fantasy worlds and surreal events and locations. Most of the time, the setting is a magical world where the characters begin an adventure. Sometimes they are sent there from the real world. Magic is often a component of this genre, and various mystical elements serve as building blocks of the story. You'll often know it's a fantasy anime if the setting and atmosphere seem so dazzling and dreamlike that it will make you feel captivated and seduced.

genre.name: Romance
genre.descripcion: Romance is all about love and sweet moments. Shows of this genre often have the ability to strike a chord with everyone with their romantic scenes and tender moments. The focus of these shows are the romantic relationships between the characters as well as their blossoming love for each other. You will often find romantic anime closely tied to the shoujo subgenre, but it also works quite well with comedy, harem and drama.

genre.name: Shoujo
genre.descripcion: Shoujo refers to the demographic of young girls. This subgenre specifically targets female viewers between the ages of 10 and 18. Most of the time, shoujo anime works hand in hand with the romance and comedy genre, particularly the former. The protagonist is traditionally female and the narrative focuses on romance as well as personal growth. The world in these shows is often highly idealized.

In general, the action genre usually has a lot of battle scenes, smooth animation and very engaging elements that will get your adrenaline pumping.

genre.name: Adventure
genre.descripcion: The adventure genre consists of traveling and undertaking an adventure in a certain place or around the world (which can sometimes escalate to the whole universe or even to other dimensions). In this genre, the protagonists do not usually stay in one place. They venture to several different locations, usually with a goal in mind (e.g., to find treasure, explore some new place, defeat a heinous villain, or save the world). Adventure anime is so broad and flexible that these shows can run to a large number of episodes, as well as overlap multiple genres, usually action.

genre.name: Drama
genre.descripcion: Bringing us tears and a wave of emotions is basically what the drama genre does best! Dramatic anime tends to connect viewers to the experiences of the characters. This results in viewers feeling what the characters are going through. Whether it's a tingle of emotion or a flood of feelings, the goal of these series is to touch our hearts. In anime, one of the biggest signs that the drama worked effectively is if it was able to make you cry.

genre.name: Fantasy
genre.descripcion: The fantasy genre in anime deals mainly with fantasy worlds and surreal events and locations. Most of the time, the setting is a magical world where the characters begin an adventure. Sometimes they are sent there from the real world. Magic is often a component of this genre, and various mystical elements serve as building blocks of the story. You'll often know it's a fantasy anime if the setting and atmosphere seem so dazzling and dreamlike that it will make you feel captivated and seduced.

genre.name: Science Fiction
genre.descripcion: Science fiction is a genre that shows scientific and technological elements in its story. Machines and various types of technologies are basic elements of this genre. Most of the time, it focuses on the advancement and development of science and technology. That is why you often find science fiction combined with subgenres such as mechanics and space.

genre.name: Historical
genre.descripcion: As the name suggests, historical anime revolves around events in history and moments in ancient times. Shows in this subgenre are typically set in Ancient Japan and the feudal period. Other settings such as the Middle Ages and the medieval period of Europe exist, but are much rarer in anime. As long as the time or setting (or even the elements) are ancient and old, then the series can be considered a historical anime.

genre.name: Shounen
genre.descripcion: Shounen refers to the target demographic for this type of anime, which is male viewers around 10 to 18 years of age. These shows are usually a combination of action and adventure and are typically adapted from manga series. As such, these anime tend to have long runs.

genre.name: Supernatural
genre.descripcion: When one says supernatural, it refers to things or events that are strange and out of the ordinary. For this category, supernatural could refer to something mythical, mystical, strange or something outside the bounds of accepted reality. There is a shadow of mystery often found in shows related to this genre.

genre.name: Life stories
genre.descripcion: When one says "slice of life," it means the good mundane life. The stories depicted in this genre are realistically set in the realm of real life. Nothing out of the ordinary happens, but that's the point! Everyday life is portrayed realistically, with nothing out of the ordinary destroying the premise.

genre.name: Romance
genre.descripcion: Romance is all about love and sweet moments. Shows of this genre often have the ability to strike a chord with everyone with their romantic scenes and tender moments. The focus of these shows are the romantic relationships between the characters as well as their blossoming love for each other. You will often find romantic anime closely tied to the shoujo subgenre, but it also works quite well with comedy, harem and drama.

genre.name: Seinen
genre.descripcion: Seinen is actually a demographic, but it is also considered a category in anime. It is a subgenre that specifically targets male viewers between the ages of 18 and 40. Shows here are portrayed in a more mature light and often include more explicit content such as gore, sex and violence. There are also more cerebral narratives.

genre.descripcion: The main purpose of the comedy genre is...you got it...to make you laugh! If it doesn't make you laugh or at least make you smile, then it's a failure. But then again, humor can depend on your personal sense of humor. The animation may not be as impressive as TV shows in the action and drama category, but that can be forgiven for the laughs. Funny moments, hilarious scenes, wacky dialogue, comical happenings... it's all covered by the comedy genre in anime!

genre.name: Demons
genre.descripcion: Originally an infrequent subject, the emergence of demonic characters and themes have given rise to this subgenre. The term demon not only encompasses literal demonic characters. It also extends to other entities such as monsters, beasts, ghosts, and other demonic-type figures. The demons present may come from biblical backgrounds or from Japanese culture.

The focus of these shows are the romantic relationships between the characters as well as their blossoming love for each other. You will often find romantic anime closely tied to the shoujo subgenre, but it also works quite well with comedy, harem and drama.

name: Baki

genre.name: Action
genre.descripcion: The action genre in anime represents extremely high levels of intense action. Often, you will witness thrilling battles and action-packed fight scenes in shows of this genre. These series will either make you jump out of your seat or knock your socks off. In general, the action genre usually has a lot of battle scenes, smooth animation and very engaging elements that will get your adrenaline pumping.

genre.name: Martial Arts
genre.descripcion: Martial arts play a big role in every anime that has fights/battles. Whether it's hand-to-hand combat, swordplay, gun fighting, or armed combat, there's some sort of martial art that plays through them. But did you know that there are shows that mainly focus on the martial arts themselves and their fighting techniques? There are many of them, and they mainly involve hand-to-hand combat and technical battles.

genre.name: Shounen
genre.descripcion: Shounen refers to the target demographic for this type of anime, which is male viewers around 10 to 18 years of age. These shows are usually a combination of action and adventure and are typically adapted from manga series. As such, these anime tend to have long runs.

genre.name: Sports
genre.descripcion: Sports anime is a program that covers characters participating in an athletic competition.

description: The protagonist, Baki Hanma, trains with an intense focus to become strong enough to surpass his father, Yujiro Hanma, the strongest fighter in the world.

name: Bakuretsu Tenshi

genre.name: Adventure
genre.descripcion: The adventure genre consists of traveling and undertaking an adventure in a certain place or around the world (which can sometimes escalate to the whole universe or even to other dimensions). In this genre, the protagonists do not usually stay in one place. They venture to several different locations, usually with a goal in mind (e.g., to find treasure, explore some new place, defeat a heinous villain, or save the world). Adventure anime is so broad and flexible that these shows can run to a large number of episodes, as well as overlap multiple genres, usually action.

genre.name: Comedy
genre.descripcion: The main purpose of the comedy genre is...you got it...to make you laugh! If it doesn't make you laugh or at least make you smile, then it's a failure. But then again, humor can depend on your personal sense of humor. The animation may not be as impressive as TV shows in the action and drama category, but that can be forgiven for the laughs. Funny moments, hilarious scenes, wacky dialogue, comical happenings... it's all covered by the comedy genre in anime!

description: Asta and Yuno were abandoned together at the same church and have been inseparable since. As children, they promised that they would compete against each other to see who would become the next Emperor Magus.

genre.name: Action
genre.descripcion: The action genre in anime represents extremely high levels of intense action. Often, you will witness thrilling battles and action-packed fight scenes in shows of this genre. These series will either make you jump out of your seat or knock your socks off. In general, the action genre usually has a lot of battle scenes, smooth animation and very engaging elements that will get your adrenaline pumping.

genre.name: Seinen
genre.descripcion: Seinen is actually a demographic, but it is also considered a category in anime. It is a subgenre that specifically targets male viewers between the ages of 18 and 40. Shows here are portrayed in a more mature light and often include more explicit content such as gore, sex and violence. There are also more cerebral narratives.

description: A Japanese businessman, captured by modern-day pirates, is written off and left for dead by his company. Tired of the corporate life, he opts to stick with the mercenaries that kidnapped him, becoming part of their gang.

genre.name: Drama
genre.descripcion: Bringing us tears and a wave of emotions is basically what the drama genre does best! Dramatic anime tends to connect viewers to the experiences of the characters. This results in viewers feeling what the characters are going through. Whether it's a tingle of emotion or a flood of feelings, the goal of these series is to touch our hearts. In anime, one of the biggest signs that the drama worked effectively is if it was able to make you cry.

genre.name: Terror
genre.descripcion: It's not hard to spot the horror genre in anime. Generally, if there are ghosts, monsters, gore, and creeps, then you're probably watching a horror series. Heavy gore and bloody violence is a common trait. The most important factor for a show to be considered horror is its ability to scare and frighten people.

genre.name: Adventure
genre.descripcion: The adventure genre consists of traveling and undertaking an adventure in a certain place or around the world (which can sometimes escalate to the whole universe or even to other dimensions). In this genre, the protagonists do not usually stay in one place. They venture to several different locations, usually with a goal in mind (e.g., to find treasure, explore some new place, defeat a heinous villain, or save the world). Adventure anime is so broad and flexible that these shows can run to a large number of episodes, as well as overlap multiple genres, usually action.

genre.name: Ecchi
genre.descripcion: The word ecchi comes from the H sound in the word hentai, which in turn means perverted in Japanese. This subgenre is generally accepted for being full of sexually provocative scenes (mild enough to be seen by the general public) and scenarios derived from innuendo and humorous situations.

genre.name: Fantasy
genre.descripcion: The fantasy genre in anime deals mainly with fantasy worlds and surreal events and locations. Most of the time, the setting is a magical world where the characters begin an adventure. Sometimes they are sent there from the real world. Magic is often a component of this genre, and various mystical elements serve as building blocks of the story. You'll often know it's a fantasy anime if the setting and atmosphere seem so dazzling and dreamlike that it will make you feel captivated and seduced.

genre.name: Martial Arts
genre.descripcion: Martial arts play a big role in every anime that has fights/battles. Whether it's hand-to-hand combat, swordplay, gun fighting, or armed combat, there's some sort of martial art that plays through them. But did you know that there are shows that mainly focus on the martial arts themselves and their fighting techniques? There are many of them, and they mainly involve hand-to-hand combat and technical battles.

You'll often find mind games here, as well as battles where the use of wits is the main focus. Series of this genre will play with your mind and make you think a lot.

genre.name: Science Fiction
genre.descripcion: Science fiction is a genre that shows scientific and technological elements in its story. Machines and various types of technologies are basic elements of this genre. Most of the time, it focuses on the advancement and development of science and technology. That is why you often find science fiction combined with subgenres such as mechanics and space.

genre.name: Seinen
genre.descripcion: Seinen is actually a demographic, but it is also considered a category in anime. It is a subgenre that specifically targets male viewers between the ages of 18 and 40. Shows here are portrayed in a more mature light and often include more explicit content such as gore, sex and violence. There are also more cerebral narratives.

description: A young man gets transported into a video game he plays called Btooom. A plot is uncovered involving an organization that aims to conquer the world by dominating the virtual world.

name: Bubuki Buranki

genre.name: Action
genre.descripcion: The action genre in anime represents extremely high levels of intense action. Often, you will witness thrilling battles and action-packed fight scenes in shows of this genre. These series will either make you jump out of your seat or knock your socks off. In general, the action genre usually has a lot of battle scenes, smooth animation and very engaging elements that will get your adrenaline pumping.

genre.name: Drama
genre.descripcion: Bringing us tears and a wave of emotions is basically what the drama genre does best! Dramatic anime tends to connect viewers to the experiences of the characters. This results in viewers feeling what the characters are going through. Whether it's a tingle of emotion or a flood of feelings, the goal of these series is to touch our hearts. In anime, one of the biggest signs that the drama worked effectively is if it was able to make you cry.

genre.name: Mecha
genre.descripcion: Mecha means mechanical (as in mechanical units or robots). You will never see a mecha anime without a robot or mech suit in it.

genre.name: Comedy
genre.descripcion: The main purpose of the comedy genre is...you got it...to make you laugh! If it doesn't make you laugh or at least make you smile, then it's a failure. But then again, humor can depend on your personal sense of humor. The animation may not be as impressive as TV shows in the action and drama category, but that can be forgiven for the laughs. Funny moments, hilarious scenes, wacky dialogue, comical happenings... it's all covered by the comedy genre in anime!

genre.name: Mystery
genre.descripcion: If there is one thing that is similar in all mystery anime shows, it is the existence of a central enigma. Whether it's an event, a place, or an object, there is some sort of mystery surrounding the narrative. In the history of anime, the most popular shows in the genre have featured detectives.

For this category, supernatural could refer to something mythical, mystical, strange or something outside the bounds of accepted reality. Magic is often a component of this genre, and various mystical elements serve as building blocks of the story. You'll often know it's a fantasy anime if the setting and atmosphere seem so dazzling and dreamlike that it will make you feel captivated and seduced.

One of the most famous themes in the magic genre is magical girls. It is so popular that it could become a whole new genre on its own in the future.

genre.descripcion: As the name suggests, historical anime revolves around events in history and moments in ancient times. Shows in this subgenre are typically set in Ancient Japan and the feudal period. Other settings such as the Middle Ages and the medieval period of Europe exist, but are much rarer in anime. As long as the time or setting (or even the elements) are ancient and old, then the series can be considered a historical anime.

genre.name: Terror
genre.descripcion: It's not hard to spot the horror genre in anime. Generally, if there are ghosts, monsters, gore, and creeps, then you're probably watching a horror series. Heavy gore and bloody violence is a common trait. The most important factor for a show to be considered horror is its ability to scare and frighten people.

name: Cossette no Shouzou

genre.name: Drama
genre.descripcion: Bringing us tears and a wave of emotions is basically what the drama genre does best! Dramatic anime tends to connect viewers to the experiences of the characters. This results in viewers feeling what the characters are going through. Whether it's a tingle of emotion or a flood of feelings, the goal of these series is to touch our hearts. In anime, one of the biggest signs that the drama worked effectively is if it was able to make you cry.

genre.name: Magic
genre.descripcion: Magic, in all its essence, is about magical things like spells and incantations. It can also include magic fountains, wish-granting beings, and good sleight-of-hand tricks. One of the most famous themes in the magic genre is magical girls. It is so popular that it could become a whole new genre on its own in the future.

genre.name: Psychologic
genre.descripcion: Psychological anime are shows that delve into the workings of the mind and psyche. This genre tackles everything on a psychological (sometimes even philosophical) level. You'll often find mind games here, as well as battles where the use of wits is the main focus. Series of this genre will play with your mind and make you think a lot.

genre.name: Romance

You will often find romantic anime closely tied to the shoujo subgenre, but it also works quite well with comedy, harem and drama.

Funny moments, hilarious scenes, wacky dialogue, comical happenings... it's all covered by the comedy genre in anime!

genre.name: Drama
genre.descripcion: Bringing us tears and a wave of emotions is basically what the drama genre does best! Dramatic anime tends to connect viewers to the experiences of the characters. This results in viewers feeling what the characters are going through. Whether it's a tingle of emotion or a flood of feelings, the goal of these series is to touch our hearts. In anime, one of the biggest signs that the drama worked effectively is if it was able to make you cry.

genre.name: Adventure

In this genre, the protagonists do not usually stay in one place. They venture to several different locations, usually with a goal in mind (e.g., to find treasure, explore some new place, defeat a heinous villain, or save the world). Adventure anime is so broad and flexible that these shows can run to a large number of episodes, as well as overlap multiple genres, usually action.

genre.name: Comedy
genre.descripcion: The main purpose of the comedy genre is...you got it...to make you laugh! If it doesn't make you laugh or at least make you smile, then it's a failure. But then again, humor can depend on your personal sense of humor. The animation may not be as impressive as TV shows in the action and drama category, but that can be forgiven for the laughs. Funny moments, hilarious scenes, wacky dialogue, comical happenings... it's all covered by the comedy genre in anime!

genre.name: Drama
genre.descripcion: Bringing us tears and a wave of emotions is basically what the drama genre does best! Dramatic anime tends to connect viewers to the experiences of the characters. This results in viewers feeling what the characters are going through. Whether it's a tingle of emotion or a flood of feelings, the goal of these series is to touch our hearts. In anime, one of the biggest signs that the drama worked effectively is if it was able to make you cry.

genre.name: Mystery
genre.descripcion: If there is one thing that is similar in all mystery anime shows, it is the existence of a central enigma. Whether it's an event, a place, or an object, there is some sort of mystery surrounding the narrative. In the history of anime, the most popular shows in the genre have featured detectives.

genre.name: Psychologic
genre.descripcion: Psychological anime are shows that delve into the workings of the mind and psyche. This genre tackles everything on a psychological (sometimes even philosophical) level. You'll often find mind games here, as well as battles where the use of wits is the main focus. Series of this genre will play with your mind and make you think a lot.

genre.name: Romance
genre.descripcion: Romance is all about love and sweet moments. Shows of this genre often have the ability to strike a chord with everyone with their romantic scenes and tender moments. The focus of these shows are the romantic relationships between the characters as well as their blossoming love for each other. You will often find romantic anime closely tied to the shoujo subgenre, but it also works quite well with comedy, harem and drama.

genre.name: School
genre.descripcion: There are countless anime that use school as a setting. An anime can be considered part of the school subgenre if the school is the main setting and the anime is primarily about school and student life.

genre.name: Seinen
genre.descripcion: Seinen is actually a demographic, but it is also considered a category in anime. It is a subgenre that specifically targets male viewers between the ages of 18 and 40. Shows here are portrayed in a more mature light and often include more explicit content such as gore, sex and violence. There are also more cerebral narratives.

But then again, humor can depend on your personal sense of humor. The animation may not be as impressive as TV shows in the action and drama category, but that can be forgiven for the laughs. Funny moments, hilarious scenes, wacky dialogue, comical happenings... it's all covered by the comedy genre in anime!

genre.name: Shounen
genre.descripcion: Shounen refers to the target demographic for this type of anime, which is male viewers around 10 to 18 years of age. These shows are usually a combination of action and adventure and are typically adapted from manga series. As such, these anime tend to have long runs.

genre.name: Supernatural
genre.descripcion: When one says supernatural, it refers to things or events that are strange and out of the ordinary. For this category, supernatural could refer to something mythical, mystical, strange or something outside the bounds of accepted reality. There is a shadow of mystery often found in shows related to this genre.

description: A kind-hearted high school student teams up with a grumpy exorcist to stop demons from causing trouble in the human world.

name: Full Metal Alchemist

genre.name: Action
genre.descripcion: The action genre in anime represents extremely high levels of intense action. Often, you will witness thrilling battles and action-packed fight scenes in shows of this genre. These series will either make you jump out of your seat or knock your socks off. In general, the action genre usually has a lot of battle scenes, smooth animation and very engaging elements that will get your adrenaline pumping.

genre.name: Adventure
genre.descripcion: The adventure genre consists of traveling and undertaking an adventure in a certain place or around the world (which can sometimes escalate to the whole universe or even to other dimensions). In this genre, the protagonists do not usually stay in one place. They venture to several different locations, usually with a goal in mind (e.g., to find treasure, explore some new place, defeat a heinous villain, or save the world). Adventure anime is so broad and flexible that these shows can run to a large number of episodes, as well as overlap multiple genres, usually action.

genre.name: Comedy
genre.descripcion: The main purpose of the comedy genre is...you got it...to make you laugh! If it doesn't make you laugh or at least make you smile, then it's a failure. But then again, humor can depend on your personal sense of humor. The animation may not be as impressive as TV shows in the action and drama category, but that can be forgiven for the laughs. Funny moments, hilarious scenes, wacky dialogue, comical happenings... it's all covered by the comedy genre in anime!

genre.name: Drama
genre.descripcion: Bringing us tears and a wave of emotions is basically what the drama genre does best! Dramatic anime tends to connect viewers to the experiences of the characters. This results in viewers feeling what the characters are going through. Whether it's a tingle of emotion or a flood of feelings, the goal of these series is to touch our hearts. In anime, one of the biggest signs that the drama worked effectively is if it was able to make you cry.

genre.name: Fantasy
genre.descripcion: The fantasy genre in anime deals mainly with fantasy worlds and surreal events and locations. Most of the time, the setting is a magical world where the characters begin an adventure. Sometimes they are sent there from the real world. Magic is often a component of this genre, and various mystical elements serve as building blocks of the story. You'll often know it's a fantasy anime if the setting and atmosphere seem so dazzling and dreamlike that it will make you feel captivated and seduced.

genre.name: Magic
genre.descripcion: Magic, in all its essence, is about magical things like spells and incantations. It can also include magic fountains, wish-granting beings, and good sleight-of-hand tricks. One of the most famous themes in the magic genre is magical girls. It is so popular that it could become a whole new genre on its own in the future.

genre.name: Military
genre.descripcion: As the name implies, this subgenre involves the military in one way or another. War can also be a big part of military anime.

genre.name: Seinen
genre.descripcion: Seinen is actually a demographic, but it is also considered a category in anime. It is a subgenre that specifically targets male viewers between the ages of 18 and 40. Shows here are portrayed in a more mature light and often include more explicit content such as gore, sex and violence. There are also more cerebral narratives.

genre.name: Historical
genre.descripcion: As the name suggests, historical anime revolves around events in history and moments in ancient times. Shows in this subgenre are typically set in Ancient Japan and the feudal period. Other settings such as the Middle Ages and the medieval period of Europe exist, but are much rarer in anime. As long as the time or setting (or even the elements) are ancient and old, then the series can be considered a historical anime.

genre.descripcion: The action genre in anime represents extremely high levels of intense action. Often, you will witness thrilling battles and action-packed fight scenes in shows of this genre. These series will either make you jump out of your seat or knock your socks off. In general, the action genre usually has a lot of battle scenes, smooth animation and very engaging elements that will get your adrenaline pumping.

genre.name: Fantasy
genre.descripcion: The fantasy genre in anime deals mainly with fantasy worlds and surreal events and locations. Most of the time, the setting is a magical world where the characters begin an adventure. Sometimes they are sent there from the real world. Magic is often a component of this genre, and various mystical elements serve as building blocks of the story. You'll often know it's a fantasy anime if the setting and atmosphere seem so dazzling and dreamlike that it will make you feel captivated and seduced.

genre.name: Shoujo
genre.descripcion: Shoujo refers to the demographic of young girls. This subgenre specifically targets female viewers between the ages of 10 and 18. Most of the time, shoujo anime works hand in hand with the romance and comedy genre, particularly the former. The protagonist is traditionally female and the narrative focuses on romance as well as personal growth. The world in these shows is often highly idealized.

genre.name: Supernatural
genre.descripcion: When one says supernatural, it refers to things or events that are strange and out of the ordinary. For this category, supernatural could refer to something mythical, mystical, strange or something outside the bounds of accepted reality. There is a shadow of mystery often found in shows related to this genre.

description: A boy who is meant to be 18 years old is trapped in a 13 year old kids body after accepting a demon sword after his home village was burnt down. He must find 8 special crystals while trying to survive with the demon in him.

name: Hakozume Kouban Joshi no Gyakushuu

genre.name: Comedy
genre.descripcion: The main purpose of the comedy genre is...you got it...to make you laugh! If it doesn't make you laugh or at least make you smile, then it's a failure. But then again, humor can depend on your personal sense of humor. The animation may not be as impressive as TV shows in the action and drama category, but that can be forgiven for the laughs. Funny moments, hilarious scenes, wacky dialogue, comical happenings... it's all covered by the comedy genre in anime!

genre.name: Life stories
genre.descripcion: When one says "slice of life," it means the good mundane life. The stories depicted in this genre are realistically set in the realm of real life. Nothing out of the ordinary happens, but that's the point! Everyday life is portrayed realistically, with nothing out of the ordinary destroying the premise.

genre.name: Police
genre.descripcion: The police subgenre emphasizes the lives and struggles of law enforcement in their line of work. Police characters have appeared in numerous shows and there are now anime that could be considered police procedurals. This genre is not exclusive to police officers, but also includes detectives, investigators and enforcers of any kind.

description: A story about two policewomen working at a small police station. Every day is a new challenge.

name: Hakyuu Houshin Engi

genre.name: Adventure
genre.descripcion: The adventure genre consists of traveling and undertaking an adventure in a certain place or around the world (which can sometimes escalate to the whole universe or even to other dimensions). In this genre, the protagonists do not usually stay in one place. They venture to several different locations, usually with a goal in mind (e.g., to find treasure, explore some new place, defeat a heinous villain, or save the world). Adventure anime is so broad and flexible that these shows can run to a large number of episodes, as well as overlap multiple genres, usually action.

genre.name: Demons
genre.descripcion: Originally an infrequent subject, the emergence of demonic characters and themes have given rise to this subgenre. The term demon not only encompasses literal demonic characters. It also extends to other entities such as monsters, beasts, ghosts, and other demonic-type figures. The demons present may come from biblical backgrounds or from Japanese culture.

In general, the action genre usually has a lot of battle scenes, smooth animation and very engaging elements that will get your adrenaline pumping.

genre.name: Drama
genre.descripcion: Bringing us tears and a wave of emotions is basically what the drama genre does best! Dramatic anime tends to connect viewers to the experiences of the characters. This results in viewers feeling what the characters are going through. Whether it's a tingle of emotion or a flood of feelings, the goal of these series is to touch our hearts. In anime, one of the biggest signs that the drama worked effectively is if it was able to make you cry.

genre.name: Military
genre.descripcion: As the name implies, this subgenre involves the military in one way or another. War can also be a big part of military anime.

genre.name: Science Fiction
genre.descripcion: Science fiction is a genre that shows scientific and technological elements in its story. Machines and various types of technologies are basic elements of this genre. Most of the time, it focuses on the advancement and development of science and technology. That is why you often find science fiction combined with subgenres such as mechanics and space.

But then again, humor can depend on your personal sense of humor. The animation may not be as impressive as TV shows in the action and drama category, but that can be forgiven for the laughs. Funny moments, hilarious scenes, wacky dialogue, comical happenings... it's all covered by the comedy genre in anime!

genre.name: Fantasy
genre.descripcion: The fantasy genre in anime deals mainly with fantasy worlds and surreal events and locations. Most of the time, the setting is a magical world where the characters begin an adventure. Sometimes they are sent there from the real world. Magic is often a component of this genre, and various mystical elements serve as building blocks of the story. You'll often know it's a fantasy anime if the setting and atmosphere seem so dazzling and dreamlike that it will make you feel captivated and seduced.

genre.name: Harem
genre.descripcion: If you see a reluctant male character surrounded by multiple adoring female characters, then you're probably watching an anime of the harem subgenre. This type of show usually features more than two female characters being turned upside down by a single male character. Anime in this category is typically within the comedy and romance genre.

genre.name: Romance
genre.descripcion: Romance is all about love and sweet moments. Shows of this genre often have the ability to strike a chord with everyone with their romantic scenes and tender moments. The focus of these shows are the romantic relationships between the characters as well as their blossoming love for each other. You will often find romantic anime closely tied to the shoujo subgenre, but it also works quite well with comedy, harem and drama.

description: When a boy is accidentally killed by God, he is resurrected in another world as recompense with his magically enhanced smartphone being only the first of his gifts there.

name: Ishura

genre.name: Action
genre.descripcion: The action genre in anime represents extremely high levels of intense action. Often, you will witness thrilling battles and action-packed fight scenes in shows of this genre. These series will either make you jump out of your seat or knock your socks off. In general, the action genre usually has a lot of battle scenes, smooth animation and very engaging elements that will get your adrenaline pumping.

genre.name: Adventure
genre.descripcion: The adventure genre consists of traveling and undertaking an adventure in a certain place or around the world (which can sometimes escalate to the whole universe or even to other dimensions). In this genre, the protagonists do not usually stay in one place. They venture to several different locations, usually with a goal in mind (e.g., to find treasure, explore some new place, defeat a heinous villain, or save the world). Adventure anime is so broad and flexible that these shows can run to a large number of episodes, as well as overlap multiple genres, usually action.

genre.name: Fantasy

You'll often know it's a fantasy anime if the setting and atmosphere seem so dazzling and dreamlike that it will make you feel captivated and seduced.

description: A host of demigods have inherited the world after the Demon King has died, and a battle to determine the mightiest ensues.

name: Island

genre.name: Drama
genre.descripcion: Bringing us tears and a wave of emotions is basically what the drama genre does best! Dramatic anime tends to connect viewers to the experiences of the characters. This results in viewers feeling what the characters are going through. Whether it's a tingle of emotion or a flood of feelings, the goal of these series is to touch our hearts. In anime, one of the biggest signs that the drama worked effectively is if it was able to make you cry.

genre.name: Science Fiction
genre.descripcion: Science fiction is a genre that shows scientific and technological elements in its story. Machines and various types of technologies are basic elements of this genre. Most of the time, it focuses on the advancement and development of science and technology. That is why you often find science fiction combined with subgenres such as mechanics and space.

genre.name: Seinen
genre.descripcion: Seinen is actually a demographic, but it is also considered a category in anime. It is a subgenre that specifically targets male viewers between the ages of 18 and 40. Shows here are portrayed in a more mature light and often include more explicit content such as gore, sex and violence. There are also more cerebral narratives.

There is a shadow of mystery often found in shows related to this genre.

In general, the action genre usually has a lot of battle scenes, smooth animation and very engaging elements that will get your adrenaline pumping.

genre.name: Fantasy
genre.descripcion: The fantasy genre in anime deals mainly with fantasy worlds and surreal events and locations. Most of the time, the setting is a magical world where the characters begin an adventure. Sometimes they are sent there from the real world. Magic is often a component of this genre, and various mystical elements serve as building blocks of the story. You'll often know it's a fantasy anime if the setting and atmosphere seem so dazzling and dreamlike that it will make you feel captivated and seduced.

genre.name: Science Fiction
genre.descripcion: Science fiction is a genre that shows scientific and technological elements in its story. Machines and various types of technologies are basic elements of this genre. Most of the time, it focuses on the advancement and development of science and technology. That is why you often find science fiction combined with subgenres such as mechanics and space.

genre.name: Shounen
genre.descripcion: Shounen refers to the target demographic for this type of anime, which is male viewers around 10 to 18 years of age. These shows are usually a combination of action and adventure and are typically adapted from manga series. As such, these anime tend to have long runs.

description: A man working a job far removed from his childhood dreams gets wrapped up in an unexpected situation...!. Becoming a monster, he aims once again to fulfill his lifelong dream...!.

genre.name: Action
genre.descripcion: The action genre in anime represents extremely high levels of intense action. Often, you will witness thrilling battles and action-packed fight scenes in shows of this genre. genre.name: Adventure
genre.descripcion: The adventure genre consists of traveling and undertaking an adventure in a certain place or around the world (which can sometimes escalate to the whole universe or even to other dimensions). In this genre, the protagonists do not usually stay in one place. They venture to several different locations, usually with a goal in mind (e.g., to find treasure, explore some new place, defeat a heinous villain, or save the world). Adventure anime is so broad and flexible that these shows can run to a large number of episodes, as well as overlap multiple genres, usually action.

genre.name: Historical
genre.descripcion: As the name suggests, historical anime revolves around events in history and moments in ancient times. Shows in this subgenre are typically set in Ancient Japan and the feudal period. Other settings such as the Middle Ages and the medieval period of Europe exist, but are much rarer in anime. As long as the time or setting (or even the elements) are ancient and old, then the series can be considered a historical anime.

description: Fena Houtman, a young orphan girl, has been raised on an island where there is no hope of becoming anything more than chattel, to be used and discarded by soldiers of the British Empire. But Fena is more than just another powerless orphan. When her mysterious past comes knocking,...

name: Kakegurui

genre.name: Drama
genre.descripcion: Bringing us tears and a wave of emotions is basically what the drama genre does best! Dramatic anime tends to connect viewers to the experiences of the characters. This results in viewers feeling what the characters are going through. Whether it's a tingle of emotion or a flood of feelings, the goal of these series is to touch our hearts. In anime, one of the biggest signs that the drama worked effectively is if it was able to make you cry.

genre.name: Mystery
genre.descripcion: If there is one thing that is similar in all mystery anime shows, it is the existence of a central enigma. Whether it's an event, a place, or an object, there is some sort of mystery surrounding the narrative. In the history of anime, the most popular shows in the genre have featured detectives.

genre.name: Psychologic
genre.descripcion: Psychological anime are shows that delve into the workings of the mind and psyche. This genre tackles everything on a psychological (sometimes even philosophical) level. You'll often find mind games here, as well as battles where the use of wits is the main focus. Series of this genre will play with your mind and make you think a lot.

genre.name: Comedy
genre.descripcion: The main purpose of the comedy genre is...you got it...to make you laugh! If it doesn't make you laugh or at least make you smile, then it's a failure. But then again, humor can depend on your personal sense of humor. The animation may not be as impressive as TV shows in the action and drama category, but that can be forgiven for the laughs. Funny moments, hilarious scenes, wacky dialogue, comical happenings... it's all covered by the comedy genre in anime!

genre.name: Romance
genre.descripcion: Romance is all about love and sweet moments. Shows of this genre often have the ability to strike a chord with everyone with their romantic scenes and tender moments. The focus of these shows are the romantic relationships between the characters as well as their blossoming love for each other. You will often find romantic anime closely tied to the shoujo subgenre, but it also works quite well with comedy, harem and drama.

description: Yin and Ning are two sisters who have been wandering the land together ever since their village was destroyed by the villainous Taibai Empire. Their childhood friend, Zhao, has been enslaved by the Taibai himself, and uses his brilliance at tinkering and inventing to get by as a slave to the Empire's whims. One day, Yin accidentally discovers a legendary sword, which grants her fantastic abilities in combat, and allows her to summon a mystical, mechanical fox spirit named Yun, who is sworn to fight by her side. Meanwhile, Zhao is making fast friends with a mysterious young girl who just may hold a great amount of power within the Taibai Empire. As Zhao and the Fu sisters find themselves increasingly caught up in the Empire's battle for supremacy over the land, it will take all of the magic and might that the budding resistance armies can muster to turn the tide of war once and for all.

genre.descripcion: If there is one thing that is similar in all mystery anime shows, it is the existence of a central enigma. Whether it's an event, a place, or an object, there is some sort of mystery surrounding the narrative. In the history of anime, the most popular shows in the genre have featured detectives.

genre.name: Shounen
genre.descripcion: Shounen refers to the target demographic for this type of anime, which is male viewers around 10 to 18 years of age. These shows are usually a combination of action and adventure and are typically adapted from manga series. As such, these anime tend to have long runs.

description: One day, Hajime and his girlfriend Miyuki visit Hong Kong for a fashion event, where Miyuki is mistaken for someone else and kidnapped. Trying to save Miyuki will lead to an altogether different criminal case.

name: Kingdom

genre.name: Action
genre.descripcion: The action genre in anime represents extremely high levels of intense action. Often, you will witness thrilling battles and action-packed fight scenes in shows of this genre. These series will either make you jump out of your seat or knock your socks off. In general, the action genre usually has a lot of battle scenes, smooth animation and very engaging elements that will get your adrenaline pumping.

genre.name: Historical
genre.descripcion: As the name suggests, historical anime revolves around events in history and moments in ancient times. Shows in this subgenre are typically set in Ancient Japan and the feudal period. Other settings such as the Middle Ages and the medieval period of Europe exist, but are much rarer in anime. As long as the time or setting (or even the elements) are ancient and old, then the series can be considered a historical anime.

genre.name: Military
genre.descripcion: As the name implies, this subgenre involves the military in one way or another. War can also be a big part of military anime.

genre.name: Seinen
genre.descripcion: Seinen is actually a demographic, but it is also considered a category in anime. It is a subgenre that specifically targets male viewers between the ages of 18 and 40. Shows here are portrayed in a more mature light and often include more explicit content such as gore, sex and violence. There are also more cerebral narratives.

description: In ancient China, a young boy dreams of becoming the greatest general of the Qin Kingdom.

name: Kino no Tabi - The Beautiful World

genre.name: Action
genre.descripcion: The action genre in anime represents extremely high levels of intense action. Often, you will witness thrilling battles and action-packed fight scenes in shows of this genre. These series will either make you jump out of your seat or knock your socks off. In general, the action genre usually has a lot of battle scenes, smooth animation and very engaging elements that will get your adrenaline pumping.

genre.name: Adventure
genre.descripcion: The adventure genre consists of traveling and undertaking an adventure in a certain place or around the world (which can sometimes escalate to the whole universe or even to other dimensions). In this genre, the protagonists do not usually stay in one place. They venture to several different locations, usually with a goal in mind (e.g., to find treasure, explore some new place, defeat a heinous villain, or save the world). Adventure anime is so broad and flexible that these shows can run to a large number of episodes, as well as overlap multiple genres, usually action.

genre.name: Life stories
genre.descripcion: When one says "slice of life," it means the good mundane life. The stories depicted in this genre are realistically set in the realm of real life. Nothing out of the ordinary happens, but that's the point! Everyday life is portrayed realistically, with nothing out of the ordinary destroying the premise.

description: Destination is a state of mind. A tale of one girl and her bike and the road ahead. Kino wanders around the world on the back of Hermes, her unusual, anthropomorphic motorcycle, only staying in each country for three days. During their adventures, they find happiness, sadness, pa...

name: Kiseijuu sei no kakuritsu (Parasyte)

genre.name: Action
genre.descripcion: The action genre in anime represents extremely high levels of intense action. Often, you will witness thrilling battles and action-packed fight scenes in shows of this genre. These series will either make you jump out of your seat or knock your socks off. In general, the action genre usually has a lot of battle scenes, smooth animation and very engaging elements that will get your adrenaline pumping.

genre.name: Drama
genre.descripcion: Bringing us tears and a wave of emotions is basically what the drama genre does best! Dramatic anime tends to connect viewers to the experiences of the characters. This results in viewers feeling what the characters are going through. Whether it's a tingle of emotion or a flood of feelings, the goal of these series is to touch our hearts. In anime, one of the biggest signs that the drama worked effectively is if it was able to make you cry.

genre.name: Psychologic
genre.descripcion: Psychological anime are shows that delve into the workings of the mind and psyche. This genre tackles everything on a psychological (sometimes even philosophical) level. You'll often find mind games here, as well as battles where the use of wits is the main focus. Series of this genre will play with your mind and make you think a lot.

genre.name: Science Fiction
genre.descripcion: Science fiction is a genre that shows scientific and technological elements in its story. Machines and various types of technologies are basic elements of this genre. Most of the time, it focuses on the advancement and development of science and technology. That is why you often find science fiction combined with subgenres such as mechanics and space.

genre.name: Seinen
genre.descripcion: Seinen is actually a demographic, but it is also considered a category in anime. It is a subgenre that specifically targets male viewers between the ages of 18 and 40. Shows here are portrayed in a more mature light and often include more explicit content such as gore, sex and violence. There are also more cerebral narratives.

genre.name: Terror
genre.descripcion: It's not hard to spot the horror genre in anime. Generally, if there are ghosts, monsters, gore, and creeps, then you're probably watching a horror series. Heavy gore and bloody violence is a common trait. The most important factor for a show to be considered horror is its ability to scare and frighten people.

description: 17-year-old Shinichi Izumi is partially infected by a Parasyte, monsters that butcher and consume humans. He must learn to co-exist with the creature if he is to survive both the life of a Parasyte and a human as part monster, part person.

name: Kishuku Gakkou no Juliet

genre.name: Action
genre.descripcion: The action genre in anime represents extremely high levels of intense action. Often, you will witness thrilling battles and action-packed fight scenes in shows of this genre. These series will either make you jump out of your seat or knock your socks off. In general, the action genre usually has a lot of battle scenes, smooth animation and very engaging elements that will get your adrenaline pumping.

genre.name: Comedy
genre.descripcion: The main purpose of the comedy genre is...you got it...to make you laugh! If it doesn't make you laugh or at least make you smile, then it's a failure. But then again, humor can depend on your personal sense of humor. The animation may not be as impressive as TV shows in the action and drama category, but that can be forgiven for the laughs. Funny moments, hilarious scenes, wacky dialogue, comical happenings... it's all covered by the comedy genre in anime!

genre.name: Romance
genre.descripcion: Romance is all about love and sweet moments. Shows of this genre often have the ability to strike a chord with everyone with their romantic scenes and tender moments. The focus of these shows are the romantic relationships between the characters as well as their blossoming love for each other. You will often find romantic anime closely tied to the shoujo subgenre, but it also works quite well with comedy, harem and drama.

genre.name: Ecchi
genre.descripcion: The word ecchi comes from the H sound in the word hentai, which in turn means perverted in Japanese. This subgenre is generally accepted for being full of sexually provocative scenes (mild enough to be seen by the general public) and scenarios derived from innuendo and humorous situations.

genre.name: Harem
genre.descripcion: If you see a reluctant male character surrounded by multiple adoring female characters, then you're probably watching an anime of the harem subgenre. This type of show usually features more than two female characters being turned upside down by a single male character. Anime in this category is typically within the comedy and romance genre.

genre.name: Fantasy

genre.name: Science Fiction

Most of the time, it focuses on the advancement and development of science and technology. That is why you often find science fiction combined with subgenres such as mechanics and space.

genre.name: Shoujo
genre.descripcion: Shoujo refers to the demographic of young girls. This subgenre specifically targets female viewers between the ages of 10 and 18. Most of the time, shoujo anime works hand in hand with the romance and comedy genre, particularly the former. The protagonist is traditionally female and the narrative focuses on romance as well as personal growth. The world in these shows is often highly idealized.

In this genre, the protagonists do not usually stay in one place. They venture to several different locations, usually with a goal in mind (e.g., to find treasure, explore some new place, defeat a heinous villain, or save the world). Adventure anime is so broad and flexible that these shows can run to a large number of episodes, as well as overlap multiple genres, usually action.

genre.descripcion: As the name suggests, historical anime revolves around events in history and moments in ancient times. Shows in this subgenre are typically set in Ancient Japan and the feudal period. Other settings such as the Middle Ages and the medieval period of Europe exist, but are much rarer in anime. As long as the time or setting (or even the elements) are ancient and old, then the series can be considered a historical anime.

Nothing out of the ordinary happens, but that's the point! Everyday life is portrayed realistically, with nothing out of the ordinary destroying the premise.

genre.name: Shounen
genre.descripcion: Shounen refers to the target demographic for this type of anime, which is male viewers around 10 to 18 years of age. These shows are usually a combination of action and adventure and are typically adapted from manga series. As such, these anime tend to have long runs.

genre.name: Supernatural
genre.descripcion: When one says supernatural, it refers to things or events that are strange and out of the ordinary. For this category, supernatural could refer to something mythical, mystical, strange or something outside the bounds of accepted reality. There is a shadow of mystery often found in shows related to this genre.

description: A psychic middle school boy tries to live a normal life and keep his growing powers under control, even though he constantly gets into trouble.

name: Mondaiji-tachi

genre.name: Comedy
genre.descripcion: The main purpose of the comedy genre is...you got it...to make you laugh! If it doesn't make you laugh or at least make you smile, then it's a failure. But then again, humor can depend on your personal sense of humor. The animation may not be as impressive as TV shows in the action and drama category, but that can be forgiven for the laughs. Funny moments, hilarious scenes, wacky dialogue, comical happenings... it's all covered by the comedy genre in anime!

genre.name: Fantasy
genre.descripcion: The fantasy genre in anime deals mainly with fantasy worlds and surreal events and locations. Most of the time, the setting is a magical world where the characters begin an adventure. Sometimes they are sent there from the real world. Magic is often a component of this genre, and various mystical elements serve as building blocks of the story. You'll often know it's a fantasy anime if the setting and atmosphere seem so dazzling and dreamlike that it will make you feel captivated and seduced.

genre.name: Supernatural
genre.descripcion: When one says supernatural, it refers to things or events that are strange and out of the ordinary. For this category, supernatural could refer to something mythical, mystical, strange or something outside the bounds of accepted reality. There is a shadow of mystery often found in shows related to this genre.

description: A trio of recruits from Earth are enlisted to participate in the Gift Games that decide a group's wealth and reputation.

name: Monogatari Series

genre.name: Mystery
genre.descripcion: If there is one thing that is similar in all mystery anime shows, it is the existence of a central enigma. Whether it's an event, a place, or an object, there is some sort of mystery surrounding the narrative. In the history of anime, the most popular shows in the genre have featured detectives.

genre.name: Romance
genre.descripcion: Romance is all about love and sweet moments. Shows of this genre often have the ability to strike a chord with everyone with their romantic scenes and tender moments. The focus of these shows are the romantic relationships between the characters as well as their blossoming love for each other. You will often find romantic anime closely tied to the shoujo subgenre, but it also works quite well with comedy, harem and drama.

genre.name: Supernatural
genre.descripcion: When one says supernatural, it refers to things or events that are strange and out of the ordinary. For this category, supernatural could refer to something mythical, mystical, strange or something outside the bounds of accepted reality. There is a shadow of mystery often found in shows related to this genre.

description: One day, Tsubasa Hanekawa encounters a giant white tiger apparition at an intersection that talks to her. Her house burns down the next day, leaving her homeless.

name: Mononogatari

genre.name: Action
genre.descripcion: The action genre in anime represents extremely high levels of intense action. Often, you will witness thrilling battles and action-packed fight scenes in shows of this genre. These series will either make you jump out of your seat or knock your socks off. In general, the action genre usually has a lot of battle scenes, smooth animation and very engaging elements that will get your adrenaline pumping.

genre.name: Seinen
genre.descripcion: Seinen is actually a demographic, but it is also considered a category in anime. It is a subgenre that specifically targets male viewers between the ages of 18 and 40. Shows here are portrayed in a more mature light and often include more explicit content such as gore, sex and violence. There are also more cerebral narratives.

genre.name: Supernatural
genre.descripcion: When one says supernatural, it refers to things or events that are strange and out of the ordinary. For this category, supernatural could refer to something mythical, mystical, strange or something outside the bounds of accepted reality. There is a shadow of mystery often found in shows related to this genre.

description: Raging after a tragic encounter with tsukumogami, Kunato joins Nagatsuki's clan that uses divine powers to send the spirits back. Nagatsuki's positive experience with tsukumogami contrasts Kunato's loss. Can she change his view?

name: Monster

genre.name: Drama
genre.descripcion: Bringing us tears and a wave of emotions is basically what the drama genre does best! Dramatic anime tends to connect viewers to the experiences of the characters. This results in viewers feeling what the characters are going through. Whether it's a tingle of emotion or a flood of feelings, the goal of these series is to touch our hearts. In anime, one of the biggest signs that the drama worked effectively is if it was able to make you cry.

genre.name: Mystery
genre.descripcion: If there is one thing that is similar in all mystery anime shows, it is the existence of a central enigma. Whether it's an event, a place, or an object, there is some sort of mystery surrounding the narrative. In the history of anime, the most popular shows in the genre have featured detectives.

genre.name: Police
genre.descripcion: The police subgenre emphasizes the lives and struggles of law enforcement in their line of work. Police characters have appeared in numerous shows and there are now anime that could be considered police procedurals. This genre is not exclusive to police officers, but also includes detectives, investigators and enforcers of any kind.

genre.name: Psychologic
genre.descripcion: Psychological anime are shows that delve into the workings of the mind and psyche. This genre tackles everything on a psychological (sometimes even philosophical) level. You'll often find mind games here, as well as battles where the use of wits is the main focus. Series of this genre will play with your mind and make you think a lot.

genre.name: Seinen

Shows here are portrayed in a more mature light and often include more explicit content such as gore, sex and violence. There are also more cerebral narratives.

genre.name: Suspense
genre.descripcion: Also known as intrigue, these films develop quickly, and all their elements revolve around the same intriguing element.

genre.name: Terror
genre.descripcion: It's not hard to spot the horror genre in anime. Generally, if there are ghosts, monsters, gore, and creeps, then you're probably watching a horror series. Heavy gore and bloody violence is a common trait. The most important factor for a show to be considered horror is its ability to scare and frighten people.

description: Tenma, a brilliant neurosurgeon with a promising future, risks his career to save the life of a critically wounded young boy. The boy, now a charismatic young man, reappears 9 years later in the midst of a string of unusual serial murders.

genre.descripcion: The space setting has always been very popular. With so much anime taking place there, it has become a sub-genre in itself. Any anime setting in the cosmos can be labeled in this category.

genre.name: Adventure
genre.descripcion: The adventure genre consists of traveling and undertaking an adventure in a certain place or around the world (which can sometimes escalate to the whole universe or even to other dimensions). In this genre, the protagonists do not usually stay in one place. They venture to several different locations, usually with a goal in mind (e.g., to find treasure, explore some new place, defeat a heinous villain, or save the world). Adventure anime is so broad and flexible that these shows can run to a large number of episodes, as well as overlap multiple genres, usually action.

genre.name: Historical
genre.descripcion: As the name suggests, historical anime revolves around events in history and moments in ancient times. Shows in this subgenre are typically set in Ancient Japan and the feudal period. Other settings such as the Middle Ages and the medieval period of Europe exist, but are much rarer in anime. As long as the time or setting (or even the elements) are ancient and old, then the series can be considered a historical anime.

description: Mushi-uta's story takes place in the near future. Ten years before the story's opening, strange insect-like creatures known as "Mushi" began appearing. The Mushi are able to consume peoples' dreams and thoughts in return for supernatural powers. At the end of episode one, protagonist Daisuke "Kakkou" Kusuriya encounters a young girl named Shiika Anmoto. The two, in time, become quite close. However, unbeknownst to Kakkou, Shiika is an escapee from a secret prison known as GARDEN where those posessed by the Mushi, known as the Mushitsuki are held. GARDEN's military force, the Special Environmental Conservation Executive Office, dispatches its finest killer to track down Shiika. However, they are faced with resistance from the Mushibane resistance organisation, led by the secretive "Ladybird."
